chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
primestream

Premises:
str = fun p : primestream => let (str, _, _) := p in str : primestream -> nat -> nat Arguments str _ _%nat_scope str is a coercion
Build_primestream : forall str : nat -> nat, (forall n m : nat, str n = str m -> n = m) -> (forall n : nat, prime (str n)) -> primestream
Record primestream : Set := Build_primestream { str : nat -> nat; str_inj : forall n m : nat, str n = str m -> n = m; str_prime : forall n : nat, prime (str n) } Arguments Build_primestream (_ _ _)%function_scope
ps = {| str := fun n : nat => nthprime (2 * n); str_inj := fun (n m : nat) (H : nthprime (2 * n) = nthprime (2 * m)) => let H0 : 2 * n = 2 * m := nthprime_inj (2 * n) (2 * m) H in (fun lemma : n = m <-> BinInt.Z.of_nat n = BinInt.Z.of_nat m => Morphisms.iff_flip_impl_subrelation (n = m) (BinInt.Z.of_nat n = BinInt.Z.of_nat m) lemma) (ZifyClasses.mkrel nat BinNums.Z eq BinInt.Z.of_nat eq (fun x y : nat => iff_sym (Znat.Nat2Z.inj_iff x y)) n (BinInt.Z.of_nat n) eq_refl m (BinInt.Z.of_nat m) eq_refl) (let H1 : BinInt.Z.mul (BinNums.Zpos (BinNums.xO BinNums.xH)) (BinInt.Z.of_nat n) =...
Inductive bool : Set := true : bool | false : bool
BinNat.N.succ_wd = Morphisms.reflexive_proper BinNat.N.succ : Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful BinNat.N.eq BinNat.N.eq) BinNat.N.succ
BinInt.Z.lt_succ_diag_r : forall n : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.lt n (BinInt.Z.succ n)
BinNat.N.strong_right_induction : forall A : BinNums.N -> Prop, Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful eq iff) A -> forall z : BinNums.N, (forall n : BinNums.N, BinNat.N.le z n -> (forall m : BinNums.N, BinNat.N.le z m -> BinNat.N.lt m n -> A m) -> A n) -> forall n : BinNums.N, BinNat.N.le z n -> A n
vec_pos : forall (X : Type) (n : nat), vec X n -> pos n -> X
ssrbool.predArgType = Type : Type
le_n : forall n : nat, n <= n
Nat.le_lt_trans : forall n m p : nat, n <= m -> m < p -> n < p
BinPosDef.Pos.compare = BinPosDef.Pos.compare_cont Eq : BinNums.positive -> BinNums.positive -> comparison Arguments BinPosDef.Pos.compare (_ _)%positive_scope
BinNat.N.eqf_equiv = {| RelationClasses.Equivalence_Reflexive := fun (x : BinNums.N -> bool) (n : BinNums.N) => eq_refl; RelationClasses.Equivalence_Symmetric := fun (x y : BinNums.N -> bool) (H : BinNat.N.eqf x y) (n : BinNums.N) => eq_sym (H n); RelationClasses.Equivalence_Transitive := fun (x y z : BinNums.N -> bool) (H : BinNat.N.eqf x y) (H0 : BinNat.N.eqf y z) (n : BinNums.N) => eq_trans (H n) (H0 n) |} : RelationClasses.Equivalence BinNat.N.eqf
BinInt.Z.add_comm : forall n m : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.add n m = BinInt.Z.add m n
Inductive Permutation (A : Type) : list A -> list A -> Prop := perm_nil : nil ~p nil | perm_skip : forall (x : A) (l l' : list A), l ~p l' -> x :: l ~p x :: l' | perm_swap : forall (x y : A) (l : list A), y :: x :: l ~p x :: y :: l | perm_trans : forall l l' l'' : list A, l ~p l' -> l' ~p l'' -> l ~p l'' Arguments Permutation [A]%type_scope (_ _)%list_scope Arguments perm_nil _%type_scope Arguments perm_skip [A]%type_scope _ [l l']%list_scope Arguments perm_swap [A]%type_scope _ _ _%list_scope Arguments perm_trans [A]%type_scope [l l' l'']%list_scope
ssrbool.predPredType : forall T : Type, ssrbool.predType T
BinIntDef.Z.of_nat = fun n : nat => match n with | 0 => BinNums.Z0 | S n0 => BinNums.Zpos (BinPos.Pos.of_succ_nat n0) end : nat -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.of_nat _%nat_scope
BinIntDef.Z.pow = fun x y : BinNums.Z => match y with | BinNums.Z0 => BinNums.Zpos BinNums.xH | BinNums.Zpos p => BinIntDef.Z.pow_pos x p | BinNums.Zneg _ => BinNums.Z0 end : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.pow (_ _)%Z_scope
Init.Nat.mul = fix mul (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => 0 | S p => m + mul p m end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.mul (_ _)%nat_scope
Znumtheory.Zgcd_is_gcd : forall a b : BinNums.Z, Znumtheory.Zis_gcd a b (BinInt.Z.gcd a b)
BinInt.Pos2Z.neg_xI : forall p : BinNums.positive, BinNums.Zneg (BinNums.xI p) = BinInt.Z.sub (BinInt.Z.mul (BinNums.Zpos (BinNums.xO BinNums.xH)) (BinNums.Zneg p)) (BinNums.Zpos BinNums.xH)
Inductive Psatz (C : Type) : Type := PsatzIn : nat -> RingMicromega.Psatz C | PsatzSquare : RingMicromega.PolC C -> RingMicromega.Psatz C | PsatzMulC : RingMicromega.PolC C -> RingMicromega.Psatz C -> RingMicromega.Psatz C | PsatzMulE : RingMicromega.Psatz C ->...-> RingMicromega.Psatz C | PsatzZ : RingMicromega.Psatz C Arguments RingMicromega.Psatz _%type_scope Arguments RingMicromega.PsatzIn _%type_scope _%nat_scope Arguments RingMicromega.PsatzSquare [C]%type_scope Arguments RingMicromega.PsatzMulC [C]%type_scope Arguments RingMicromega.PsatzMulE [C]%type_scope Arguments RingMicromega.PsatzAdd [C]%type_scope Arguments RingMicromega.PsatzC [C]%type_scope Arguments RingMicromega.PsatzZ _%type_scope
NoDup_cons : forall (A : Type) (x : A) (l : list A), ~ In x l -> NoDup l -> NoDup (x :: l)
concat : forall A : Type, list (list A) -> list A
Inductive option (A : Type) : Type := Some : A -> option A | None : option A Arguments option _%type_scope Arguments Some {A}%type_scope a : rename Arguments None {A}%type_scope
BinNatDef.N.modulo = fun a b : BinNums.N => snd (BinNatDef.N.div_eucl a b) : BinNums.N -> BinNums.N -> BinNums.N Arguments BinNatDef.N.modulo (_ _)%N_scope
Nat.eq_dec : forall n m : nat, {n = m} + {n <> m}
BinNat.N.le_ge_cases : forall n m : BinNums.N, BinNat.N.le n m \/ BinNat.N.le m n
BinIntDef.Z.mul = fun x y : BinNums.Z => match x with | BinNums.Z0 => BinNums.Z0 | BinNums.Zpos x' => match y with | BinNums.Z0 => BinNums.Z0 | BinNums.Zpos y' => BinNums.Zpos (BinPos.Pos.mul x' y') | BinNums.Zneg y' => BinNums.Zneg (BinPos.Pos.mul x' y') end | BinNums.Zneg x' => match y with | BinNums.Z0 => BinNums.Z0 | BinNums.Zpos y' => BinNums.Zneg (BinPos.Pos.mul x' y') | BinNums.Zneg y' => BinNums.Zpos (BinPos.Pos.mul x' y') end end : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.mul (_ _)%Z_scope
